_header: O root of truth O princess to my pay
_description: To his virtuous mistress — five lines (abbcc)

BLAdd5465.Editions:
Fehr,  Bernhard. 
             “Die Lieder des Fairfax MS (Add. 5465 Brit. Mus.).” 
             Archiv für das Studium der neueren Sprachen und
                Literaturen
         106 (1901): 48-70: 58.
Stevens,  John,
                        ed.  
             Music and Poetry in the Early Tudor Court.
         London: Methuen, 1961: 363.

BLAdd60577.Transcription:
O rote of trouthe princes to my payeEndued with vertue and goodly
                    plesaunceIn whome all vertue ys knytt withouten varyaunceWith welthe
                    and worldly ioy longe to endureI pray God hertely without
                    mysaventure
BLAdd60577.Facsimiles:
Wilson,  Edward. 
             “Introduction.” 
             The Winchester Anthology. A Facsimile of British Library Additional
                Manuscript 60577. With an account of the music by 
                    Iain
                    Fenlon. 
         Cambridge: D. S. Brewer, 1981.

Wilson,  Edward. 
             “Some New Texts of Early Tudor Songs.”

         n.s. 27 [225] (1980): 293-5: 294.
